Pre-Game Insights: India and Pakistan will lock horns in a crucial group game of the T20 World Cup on June 9, 2024, at Nassau County International Cricket Stadium, East Meadow, New York.
India thrashed Ireland in their opening match, winning by eight wickets, while Pakistan lost their opener against the United States, making it a 'must-win' for Pakistan.
India and Pakistan have played seven matches in T20 World Cups, with India winning seven, Pakistan winning one, and one match ending in a tie.
Former Indian captain Virat Kohli and current Pakistani captain Babar Azam are key players, with Kohli earning Rs. 7 crore annually and Babar earning Rs. 43,50,000 annually.
Indian captain Rohit Sharma and Pakistani player Mohammad Rizwan have similar salary differences, with Sharma earning Rs. 7 crore annually and Rizwan earning Rs. 43,50,000 annually.
Indian bowler Jasprit Bumrah and Pakistani bowler Shaheen Afridi both have A+ contracts, with Bumrah earning Rs. 7 crore annually and Afridi earning Rs. 43,50,000 annually.
Indian player Ravindra Jadeja earns Rs. 7 crore annually, while Pakistani player Fakhar Zaman earns Rs. 31 lakhs annually.
Indian wicket-keeper batsman Rishabh Pant earns Rs. 5 crore annually, while Pakistani player Iftikhar Ahmed earns Rs. 26.28 lakh annually.
